intro: Myoxanthus aspasicensis, commonly known as the Aspasicense Myoxanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often covered in a fine, hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
